page.title: 14VERNDITCH CHASE: BOWERCHALKE
page.content: THE CHASE is situated to the SW and consists of 230 acres of deciduous woodland, 6 acres of hazel coppice and 90 acres of conifers. It is managed by the Forestry Commission whose Ranger lives in the village. It was planted in 1930, but now policy is to increase deciduous trees especially beech for high quality timber, phasing out conifers, now sold for wood pulp. One cleared area, privately owned, has rare orchids and butterflies. It has been designated a SITE OF SPECIAL SCIENTIFIC INTEREST. Fees may be paid for wood or for horse riding. CONSERVATION is an important part of its management. The Hampshire Trust for Nature Conservation owns the S & SW edge. A small area in the NW, privately owned is Ancient Forest, together with Chettle Head Copse - 19 acres - the last surviving.
